channel.title: Server & Hosting
channel.description: What is the difference between a server and regular hosting? Why would you want a server, and why would you want hosting? Please explain what is good about each of them and which is the best out of them two.

item.title: Server & Hosting
item.description:
@5111 wrote:

leader:

What is the difference between a server and regular hosting? Why would you want a server, and why would you want hosting? Please explain what is good about each of them and which is the best out of them two.

here are the diffrences

Regular hosting:

the average person has around 1-3gb of ram
Now this is ok for hosting but it really depends on your internet connection speed, To have a fast connection I recomend that A person has atleast 10mbps-20mbps+

Hosting from a server

Now this is the more expencive way to go if you can’t host
Servers usualy offer

• 2x300 GB disk drive
• 2000 GB bandwidth
• 4 GB RAM
• Linux: CentOS or Fedora
• cPanel unlimited control pannel

Now using a dedi server makes it ALOT easyer on your computer because if you try to host by your self 24-7 you have to leave your computer on with your server running, This usualy screws up your processor internaly your computer is screwed

If I had to choose between the two I’d go with the dedicated server
(just saying that because my computer is pretty expencive and I wouldnt want to ruin it)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 21, 2009, 06:35:12 pm[/size][hr]I hope I helped you

Read full topic

item.title: Server & Hosting
item.dc:creator: @minnergod1 minnergod1
item.description:
@minnergod1 wrote:

Because some people cant host, so they make a server and get someone else to host, or its the other way around and they cant code but they can host. To get one either you can make it from scratch or use someone’s that was already made but give them cred’z for it. But i prefer to do both that way i know i made it, and then no1 can tell me what to do XD
